div.bibl: The Chicago Chronicle, Wk. of December 17, 1926. Vol X. p.1.

body.p: Leo Straus, 69 years of age, and a well known figure in the city's business, social, and philanthropic circles, died last week. He was born in Ligonier, Indiana.
He came to Chicago when a young man, and entered the liquor business with his brother, amassing a fortune.
Mr. Straus was a trustee of Sinai Temple, a member of the Standard and Lake Shore Country Clubs.
